fields.description:
I'm proposing a change to the way bitbucket handles users emails and the user account in a commit log.\\
I'm currently commiting code for a company and for personal projects.  My employer wants me to commit everything with work email in my username in hgrc and I want to use my personal email for everything else.\\
The problem is that the commit will only link back to my user account if the email matched up.  Also if you change your email all old commits loss the link.  I'm proposing that bitbucket either:

# Offer users the ability to have multiple emails registered for them where only one gets used for notifications/primary.
# Bitbucket allows user accounts to be connected in someway or a single user account having the ability to have sub-accounts.\\
I prefer the first.\\
The current implementation has been confusing and causes issues if the user changes there email address.  Personally I can just create two accounts one for work and one for personal but that is very hackish and they will not be deeply connected.
fields.summary: Email and Commit User

fields.description:
One of DKs Quests Asking you to kill 150 mob with a flying dragon\\
i killed whole mobs i saw and cleared the map and its all 86 mobs got killed.\\
i waited 1 hour and they didnt ressed need help >.>!!
fields.summary: Mobs ressing bugged ?

fields.description: I want to change my username to lower case.
fields.summary: Change username to lower case
Pushing fail

fields.description:
I've tried to use markdown as my markup language of choice. But I couldn't get Bitbucket to render it correctly. All combinations I could think of (preamble on top, in second line, as Windows file, as Unix file, preamble after the first heading, renaming the file to README.markdown) did not work.

Bitbucket always shows the text als non-formatted. It does however recognize that I changed the format (since my README is not displayed as pre-formatted anymore), but it does not compile my README. And I have no choice of seeing the error. Online markdown parsers had no problem parsing my file, is Bitbucket maybe more strict?

My test project was webvariants/varisale, but I will be stripping the test commits soon.

Greetings,\\
Christoph
fields.summary: Markdown in READMEs not working?

fields.description: The Death knight quest when you have to use the teleport portal behind the lich king doesn't work !!! please fix this issue !!!
fields.summary: BUG Report

fields.description:
I'd like to place a compiled Android application (an .apk-file) in the Downloads-section of my project. This is of course straightforward, but when I point my Android phone to that URL it reports that the file is of an unknown type, and I am unable to install the application.

I have not had a similar experience when uploading an .apk to other places, and I suspect that it is because of the media type, which bitbucket declares as "application/octet-stream".

[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/APK_(file_format)|The correct media-type for .apk files is "application/vnd.android.package-archive".]]
fields.summary: .apk files are served with a confusing media type for Android-phones (BB-887)

fields.description:
After renaming repository, pull and push fails with this error:

jmv@brevis:~/linguist% hg push ssh://bb/linguist/TheLinguist\\
remote: ponq: don't know which shard linguist/TheLinguist is on.\\
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!
fields.summary: Error after renaming repository: ponq: don't know which shard

fields.description:
If a Reset Password is requested, the user must enter their email address, and a reset link is emailed to the account owner.

However: if the email address used during account signup is different from the current email address on file, the reset link will never arrive.

To solve this, I changed my account-specified email address back to the one I used when setting up the account. I then re-requested a password-reset, and that worked.

fyi - I was able to get into my account without my password, via OpenID, but I was unable to access my code repository until I reset the password. (just in case you were wondering).
fields.summary: Reset Password functionality breaks with changed email address (BB-573)

fields.description:
I registered for bitbucket with an OpenID. I now have no ability to access my repository, as I have no password set up. I never received an email upon registration, and I've requested a password reset several times yet have not received any emails with a link to reset.

Please send me a link as soon as possible, as I'm unable to grab code from my newly-created repository (that a friend has already made a commit to).

Thanks!!!
fields.summary: No password due to OpenID-based registration

Hey guys, there's not only Google Analytics out there.. Ever heard of [[http://www.piwik.org|Piwik]]? Would be nice to use my own Piwik server to track my bitbucket projects.

You can make this possible by either allowing custom javascript or at least external images in project descriptions..

fields.description:
On the welcome page of a newly created wiki, this is displayed as the wiki's repository url:

http://bitbucket.org/<user>/<project>wiki

It is missing a slash, and should be:

http://bitbucket.org/<user>/<project>/wiki

Here is the full context in which the incorrect url appears:

----
==== Wiki Features ====

This wiki uses the Creole syntax, and is fully compatible with the 1.0 specification.

The wiki itself is actually a hg repository, which means you can clone it, edit it locally/offline, add images or any other file type, and push it back to us. It will be live immediately.

Go ahead and try:

$ hg clone http://bitbucket.org/chadversary/cs406wiki/

----
fields.summary: URL for wiki repo is incorrect on new wiki welcome page

fields.description:
Submitting the form at http://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/consumers/apply/ gives a CSRF error.

The form has a CSRF token but I believe the error is that the form action is set to http://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/consumers/apply/

If I modify the form's action to be the same URL as displaying the form, then it submits successfully.

Cheers,

Steve

fields.description:
Hi all,

I find it difficult to identify a tool that does good VCS *as well as*  good team communication (ticket management, collaborative documentation etc.).  It just makes so much sense to have them all "close together" in the same context.  While the current BB issue tracking is fine, I find the Wiki to be too basic and cumbersome, esp. if you have non-techies in the project.

Have you taken a look at TeamBox yet?  http://teambox.com\\
It's on RoR, so not a natural candidate for your pythonic setup, but still would be a fantastic addition to bitbucket. I've been using it with my team and we all love it!

The prices on teambox.com are quite steep though.  If you asked me, I  would be happy to pay BB an extra few bucks on top of my normal BB plan, for having the opensource Teambox nicely integrated into BB.

What do you guys think?  How large is the effort to integrate it?

Cheers,\\
Nicklas
fields.summary: Integrate TeamBox into BB

fields.description:
See the [[http://bitbucket.org/help/FAQ/wiki|wiki help]]. It looks as though it's been vandalised.

So, I thought, I can fix that. I went to get the previous good version text. But it gives me a [[http://bitbucket.org/jespern/help/src/5350f2de5061/FAQ/wiki.wiki|404 file not found]].

I thought, that's okay, I'll clone the wiki repo.

{{{\\
hg clone https://cmcqueen1975@bitbucket.org/jespern/help\\
}}}

Unfortunately, I'm on Windows, and I got a case-folding collision with {{{Sandbox.wiki}}} and {{{SandBox.wiki}}}. I followed the instructions I found somewhere to fix that. But I couldn't push it back to bitbucket--got an authorisation failure.

Then, I thought, oh well, I'll just get the latest good version of {{{FAQ/wiki.wiki}}} from the repo, then paste it online. Then, I discovered that the wiki repo mysteriously ends at 9 Apr 2010. So, it seems it's not the "real" repo for the wiki, but an old clone. Hence the 404 file not found I got before.

I can't find any other easy way to rollback the vandalisation of the wiki.

So there you go. I tried to help, but couldn't for several reasons.
fields.summary: Unable to contribute fix to help wiki

fields.description:

Hi,

I'd like to be able to link to class names. Linking to line numbers has the limitation that line numbers may change often, whereas class names usually do not.

If I post a link to https://bitbucket.org/Svedrin/mumble-django/src/tip/pyweb/mumble/forms.py#cl-58 somewhere, I can't be sure that this line will still read {{{class PropertyModelForm( ModelForm ):}}} in a few weeks - perhaps I added an import or a new class and the line numbers changed.

Thanks,\\
Svedrin

fields.description:
Hi guys,

when you create a tag and download the the file from "Tags & snapshots" there is a .hg-folder in the archive. I think it is not desirable to have a hidden scm-folder or -file in the archive, since a developer would and should be able to clone or fork a repository and all others just download an archive file to compile/interpret the code.

Ciao Jochen

fields.description:
Per the title, take a look here:\\
https://bitbucket.org/help/Home

Someone vandalized the wiki and removed the entry about editing the wiki.

In addition, I can see the history of the page at:https://bitbucket.org/help/FAQ/wiki#ahooooooj-vole however, I don't know how to revert it on the web front end.

I tried to pull it down using\\
{{{\\
hg clone http://bitbucket.org/help BitBucketWiki\\
}}}

but I'm on Windows, and there are 2 Sandbox.wiki files, varying only by capitalization, so I cannot pull it down.  I get an error of: "abort: case-folding collision between Sandbox.wiki and SandBox.wiki"

I tried to help :)  But I'm stuck, so maybe someone on a Linux box  can pull it down and fix that page, and get rid of one of those SandBox.wiki files so Windows folks can help.

Sorry if I'm being a newb here and just missing an easier way to do this.
fields.summary: Someone vandalized FAQ and removed Wiki entry

fields.description:
The sort order of 3 changes in my private newsfeed is incorrect after I pushed a multi-commited changeset (there were 3 commits) to my bitbucket repository.

The oldest of the 3 changes is shown at the top, while you would expect it at the bottom.\\
See screenshot
fields.summary: Newsfeed sort order is wrong on multi-commit push

fields.description:
Here's and example.\\
http://jfine.bitbucket.org/docs/js4py/ works just fine, while http://jfine.bitbucket.org/docs/js4py has messed up links (to style files, JavaScript and other pages).

This affects other sites, such as http://tortoisehg.bitbucket.org/manual/1.1

If instead of serving the page you issued a redirect that appended the slash all would be fine.

Many thanks to you for setting up bitbucket.

Jonathan
fields.summary: http://user.bitbucket.org/path/to/dir should, but does not, redirect (BB-391)

fields.description: The emails I get about new notifications link to bitbucket.org/notifications/, where the correct URL is bitbucket.org/account/notifications/
fields.summary: Notifications emails link to bad URL

fields.description: http://bitbucket.org/OpenTTD/openttd.bitbucket.org doesn't work and it isn't possible to create a repo OpenTTD.bitbucket.org
fields.summary: webpage repo <user>.bitbucket.org and <user> does conflict with case sensitivity

fields.description: I've forked a patch repo but when I try to qclone it I get only the patches and not the base repo.
fields.summary: forking a MQ repo doesn't allow to qclone (BB-839)

fields.description:
If I go to my CNAME site ( http://hg.grumpydev.com ) and sign in (via OpenID) it actually signs me into http://bitbucket.org, and switching back to my CNAME again sees me still logged out.

It would be nice if I could do everything within my CNAME domain.
fields.summary: Logging in from custom CNAME actually logs into main bitbucket site

fields.description:
On most pages, one gets an e.g. "Home -> Development" header. It would be nice if this could be extended to "Home -> Development -> MyClassDetails" kind of scheme, so the user could click "Development" in the header, and return to that page. It seems "/" is the most natural separator.

Example page: http://bitbucket.org/gatoatigrado/sketch-frontend/wiki/Development/FrontendCode

thanks,\\
Nicholas
fields.summary: change "/" into a subpage arrow (breadcrumbs in wiki urls) (BB-838)

fields.description:
Take a look at this url:

http://hg.modafocas.org/modafocas-parent/wiki/Home

When looking at the address for wiki checkout, it gets this result:

$  hg clone https://aldrinleal@bitbucket.org/modafocas-parent/wiki

Simply said, it gets invalid. Perhaps is cache or something like that.
fields.summary: When CNAME'ing, Wiki URL shown is invalid

fields.description:
I'm running Identifox 0.9 on Firefox 3.6.6 on Kubuntu 4.2.0 on an Asus 1101HAB and the font is too large to read. Messages overlap.

Also using Echofon 1.9.6.4 which has a much smaller font and is better for reading.

Thanks.\\
--Algot\\
algot.runeman@verizon.net
fields.summary: font

fields.description:
When logging into my CNAME'ed Bitbucket with OpenID, I get redirected after authenticating with the OpenID server to Bitbucket.org, not to my CNAME domain.

Username/password login seems to work.
fields.summary: OpenID login doesn't work with CNAME (BB-837)

fields.description:
Whe the sign in button is pressed firefox and internet explorer report that the certificate is not correct, i.e. it has been issued to another site.

Your site is either being used in a phishing attack, or you have setup this incorrectly.  Kindly fix this problem.
fields.summary: Firefox and Internet explorer do not allow login into website

fields.description:
Hello,

How can I get Invoices ?

Cyril
fields.summary: Invoice

fields.description:
After doing some first hg push, I edited a few more files and hg pushed once more:\\
{{{\\
crea@alpha:~/devel/moneyguru$ hg push\\
Enter passphrase for key '/home/crea/.ssh/id_rsa':\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/some/repo\\
pushing subrepo lib\\
searching for changes\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: crea\\
password:\\
abort: authorization failed\\
}}}\\
But now, there is always this "http authorization required" thing, even when I do not use hg via HTTPS.\\
What's wrong here?

(Note: my first commit/push was with an https repository, there it worked without problems).
fields.summary: hg push always asks for http authorization, even with ssh

fields.description:
I've just created a new repository, and pushed to it a first commit.\\
{{{\\
svartalf ~/projects/python/geekfest  $  hg push\\
pushing to http://bitbucket.org/svartalf/geekfest/\\
searching for changes\\
remote: adding changesets\\
remote: adding manifests\\
remote: adding file changes\\
remote: added 1 changesets with 6 changes to 6 files\\
remote: added 1 changesets with 13 changes to 13 files\\
remote: bb/acl: svartalf is allowed. accepted payload.\\
remote: bb/acl: hinze is allowed. accepted payload.\\
remote: quota: 2.8 MB in use, 2.5 GB available (0.11% used)\\
}}}

Who is this "hinze" and what I've just pushed to him?
fields.summary: Strange push response

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm trying to login into my bitbucket account but I'm receiving the next error message:

Forbidden (403)

CSRF verification failed. Request aborted.

More information is available with DEBUG=True.

I noticed that using ssh connection from my local repo still work properly

Greetings
fields.summary: Sign in problems

fields.description:
When pushing some changes just a few minutes ago, I received the following status from hg:

{{{\\
pushing to https://mcameron:***@bitbucket.org/mcameron/warmhealth\\
searching for changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 4 changesets with 9 changes to 9 files\\
bb/acl: maximgavrilov is allowed. accepted payload.\\
}}}

I would like to know why that occurred and make sure that no one has access to this repository outside of the assigned users!
fields.summary: Wrong Username Shown on Push
Documentation errors
